segment.source: How to Revert Extension Points From an App-V 5.0 Package to an App-V 4.6 Package for a Specific User
segment.target: How to Revert Extension Points From an App-V 5.0 Package to an App-V 4.6 Package for a Specific User

segment.source: How to Revert Extension Points From an App-V 5.0 Package to an App-V 4.6 Package for a Specific User
segment.target: How to Revert Extension Points From an App-V 5.0 Package to an App-V 4.6 Package for a Specific User

segment.source: How to Revert Extension Points From an App-V 5.0 Package to an App-V 4.6 Package for a Specific User
segment.target: How to Revert Extension Points From an App-V 5.0 Package to an App-V 4.6 Package for a Specific User

segment.source: Note:* App-V 4.6 has exited Mainstream support.
segment.target: Note:* App-V 4.6 has exited Mainstream support.

segment.source: Use the following procedure to revert an App-V 5.0 package to the App-V file format using the user configuration file.
segment.target: Use the following procedure to revert an App-V 5.0 package to the App-V file format using the user configuration file.

segment.source: To revert a package
segment.target: To revert a package

segment.source: Ensure that App-V 4.6 package is published to the users but the FTAs and shortcuts have been assumed by App-V 5.0 package using the following migration method, How to Migrate Extension Points From an App-V 4.6 Package to App-V 5.0 for a Specific User.
segment.target: Ensure that App-V 4.6 package is published to the users but the FTAs and shortcuts have been assumed by App-V 5.0 package using the following migration method, How to Migrate Extension Points From an App-V 4.6 Package to App-V 5.0 for a Specific User.

segment.source: In the userConfiguration section of the deployment configuration file for the converted package, to set the policy, make the following update to the userConfiguration section: ManagingAuthority TakeoverExtensionPointsFrom46="false" PackageName=Package ID
segment.target: In the userConfiguration section of the deployment configuration file for the converted package, to set the policy, make the following update to the userConfiguration section: ManagingAuthority TakeoverExtensionPointsFrom46="false" PackageName=Package ID

segment.source: From an elevated command prompt, type:
segment.target: From an elevated command prompt, type:

segment.source: PSPublish-AppVClientPackage $pkg –DynamicUserConfigurationPathpath to user configuration file
segment.target: PSPublish-AppVClientPackage $pkg –DynamicUserConfigurationPathpath to user configuration file

segment.source: Perform a publishing refresh, or wait for the next scheduled publishing refresh for the App-V 4.6.
segment.target: Perform a publishing refresh, or wait for the next scheduled publishing refresh for the App-V 4.6.

segment.source: Open the application using FTAs or shortcuts.
segment.target: Open the application using FTAs or shortcuts.

segment.source: The Application should now open using App-V 4.6 SP2.
segment.target: The Application should now open using App-V 4.6 SP2.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: If you do not need the App-V 5.0 package anymore, you can unpublish the App-V 5.0 package and the extension points will automatically revert to App-V 4.6.
segment.target: If you do not need the App-V 5.0 package anymore, you can unpublish the App-V 5.0 package and the extension points will automatically revert to App-V 4.6.

segment.target: Got a suggestion for App-V?
